Keeper Rules

Everything you need to know about keeping players

Keeper League Guidelines

Understanding Paul Walker League's player retention


Note: You do not need to keep any players if you do not want to.


View Keeper Tracker

Keeper Eligibility

  • Players drafted 4th round or later are eligible to be kept
  • Players picked up off waivers are eligible to be kept
  • Traded players are keeper eligible

Keeper Deadline

  • Keepers must be declared before draft start
  • This can be done up to the start of the first round

Keeper Limits

  • You do not need to utilize your keeper options!
  • You can only keep a player for 2 years maximum

Draft Cost

  • Year 1: -2 rounds (5th round player costs 3rd round pick)
  • Year 2: -4 rounds (5th round player costs 1st round pick)
  • Waiver pickups count as 10th round picks (if drafted after 12th round)
Important

Draft Cost Examples

Example: You want to keep a 5th round player. Year 1, he costs your 3rd round pick. You may keep that player again for your 1st round pick in year 2.

Info

Waiver Pickup Rules

Any player drafted after the 10th round or picked up off waivers will be counted as 10th round picks for keeper purposes.

Info

Player Round Assignment

A player's round is tied to their original draft position. If a player drafted in the 6th round was injured and dropped, an owner that picks that player up can keep that player for their 4th round pick.

Important

Keeper Declaration Process

To declare a keeper, either text the commissioner or declare it on draft day.

Keeper Examples

Real examples of how keeper costs work

Example 1: 5th Round Player

Player: Breece Hall

Original Draft: Round 5, Pick 8

Year 1 Keeper Cost: Round 3, Pick 8 (-2 rounds)

Year 2 Keeper Cost: Round 1, Pick 8 (-4 rounds)

Status: Eligible for 2 years

Example 2: Waiver Pickup

Player: Puka Nacua

Acquired: Waiver Wire (Undrafted)

Year 1 Keeper Cost: Round 8, Pick 10 (-2 from 10th)

Year 2 Keeper Cost: Round 6, Pick 10 (-4 from 10th)

Status: Eligible for 2 years

Example 3: Dropped Player

Player: Cooper Kupp

Original Draft: Round 6, Pick 2

Status: Dropped due to injury

New Owner Keeper Cost: Round 4, Pick 2 (-2 from 6th)

Note: Round tied to original draft position
